intro: Monactineirma hederacea, commonly known as the creeping wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense mats on the ground. Its leaves are typically covered with fine hairs, and it produces small, edible fruits that contain seeds. Monactineirma hederacea is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
